reviews.text: I paid 90 pesos a night (could have paid less if dollars were used at 6.50/dollar) for a bed in an empty four-person dorm. I found all four beds clean and free of bed bugs, which others have reported here. (Note to hostel: replacing the wooden bunks and storage spaces with metal bunks and lockers would basically solve your bed bug problem.)
reviews.title: For the price, average

reviews.text: For the price, I felt like it was a fair, but unexceptional value. Bed was comfortable, showers were hot, staff was friendly, breakfast was adequate.
reviews.title: Chilled place, neat bar.

reviews.text: Would have been nice to have some directions in the room about operating the a/c, because it was just hot enough to use it during my trip, but I didn't feel like bugging the staff late at night.
reviews.title: Amazing- staff extremely helpful and friendly

reviews.text: Location is about three blocks downhill from the bus terminal -- quiet and residential.
reviews.title: Bed bugs

reviews.text: Bambu is a nice little laid back hostel with a warm, friendly vibe. Rooms aren't that big, but they do have shelving for your gear. They also have a/c which is awesome if you're not used to a tropical climate. Chris is super friendly and helpful and Roberto is chilled and makes a wicked Caipirinha!
reviews.title: Pretty good hostel :)

reviews.text: The staff is very helpful. I just asked about how one goes to São Paulo and right away the receptionist started calling around asking the prices with different bus agencies. I was there alone so I liked that the staff always said hello and remembered my name. The breakfast was good with the only good croissants I have had on my 7 months travel around South America. The rooms have real air condition and not just a fan! Lovely in the very humid heat. In the heat you can as well use the pool of another hostel nearby. Good location: close to the bus station and the center of the small town of Puerto Iguazu, and the bus to go to Brazil passes right by in front.
reviews.title: Good location and helpful staff

reviews.text: The only problem was the sewer problem which meant blocked toilets and there was a continuously lack of toilet paper the 3 days I stayed.
reviews.title: Place to crash

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to crash out at the end of the day obllvious to your surroundings this is the place for you. The hostel seems to be run by young men and their stantards tend not to be high. The computer is great but everything from there is downhill. I booked into the ten bed dorm and the mould stains on the ceiling creeping down the walls was enough to put me off, the bathrooms had probably been clean in the morning by by the evening when I arrived they put me off having a shower. My boyfriiend was arriving from England and we had booked a double room but when I looked at the bedroom the stain on the bedspread was enough for me to cancel the booking and move out the next morning. The staff working during the day were extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Staff

reviews.text: We stayed in a double room for 3 nights. The rooms were basic and clean, but could do with a new coat of paint, for the price of accommodation in Puerto Iguasso it represents good value.
reviews.title: Great hostel

reviews.text: The amazing thing about this hostel would be the staff, each morning they would ask us what we were doing for the day and would then help us with bookings, bus timetables etc (at no charge). They offered great advice regarding restaurants and cheap cafes. This as all done without prompting from us and appeared to be a genuine desire to be helpful, not to sell a tour or take commission from a booking.
reviews.title: Bambu Mini Hostel - Great location

reviews.text: I am on a long cycling tour of South America. Having travelled non-stop through Uruguay, southern Brazil and Misiones, Argentina - I needed to take a week off and rest. The hostel I had originally planned on staying at was full, fortunately they sent me here. You do need to be aware that there are two Hostel Bambu's. You pass the other property on the way to this one. Reports at the other property were not great, but it is currently undergoing a refurbishment.
reviews.title: Perfect place to relax for a week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I settled into the large dormitory which is huge, not just plenty of beds, but also plenty of free space. Ablutions were cleaned daily, water is hot. Toilets take a little practice in that they are quite cramped. There is plenty of space to relax, although it may be a little bit cramped if the hostel was full and the heavens opened.
reviews.title: good service: like a tourist information

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WiFi is the best quality I have had in two months - was able to Skype, upload large photos and videos without a problem. Breakfast is pretty simple, but more than adequate. Bus station, shops, restaurants and a laundry services are all within 2 mins walking distance.
reviews.title: BED BUGS.

reviews.text: Staff all speak excellent English and will greet and speak to you on a first name basis after a day. Information provided is excellent, not only for the standard tourist stuff like visiting the falls, but some more specialist stuff like arranging for some clients to have their money changed on site to giving me directions to doctors, trying to load pre-paid mobile cards etc.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Big thank you to Juan, Chris and Roberto for looking after me for an entire week!
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed here for 3 mights in march 2012. it was fairly clean (not spotless) and the breakfast was terrible but it was overall ok. not a huge amount of charm really
reviews.title: pretty good - expensive enough for what you get though

reviews.text: Ian was great help with all the info - suggested prioritized order of viewing the falls (lower circuit, boat ride, train to Devil's Throat, then upper circuit). 2 blocks from bus station. Clean room and bathroom. Weak wi-fi signal, average breakfast. No regrets.
reviews.title: Location, clean, friendly, functional
An average hostel
reviews.text: Of the many hostels we have stayed in recently, this was neither the best nor the worst. It was certainly clean, and the rooms were all comfortable. But the kitchen was very poorly equipped, and we didn't find the staff particularly friendly.
We were not fans of Bambu mini. The private room with ensuite was nice, but nothing special. The double without ensuite and the 4 bed dorm were fine, but less nice than the double with ensuite.
reviews.title: Not for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having air conditioning was great, and in the heat and hunidity of Iguazu, necessary but that's the only thing I'll rave about. The kitchen was woefully equipped, though a nice, big space, and the bathrooms were functional without water.
reviews.title: Worth considering
